items.content_html: improve the legibility of the combinator section to help readers more quickly move on to the correct page.
items.title: Minor: CSS combinators

items.content_html: This PR updates release notes for Fx115 (released on July 04) and preps release note pages for Fx116 and Fx117.
items.title: docs(relnote): Update Fx115 release notes

items.content_html:
FF116 adds support for specifying allowed eternal files in CSP script-src directives as hashes.

This adds docs on the feature (been around for ages in Chrome), but in FF only supported for inline scripts before now.

Related docs work in #27749
items.title: FF116 CSP script-src can specify hash for external files

items.content_html:
This change is to add a sample HOBA scheme representation for developers to see.

There is another scheme out there for authentication with HTTP. It is defined here:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7486

Motivation

In order to facilitate use of HOBA auth with developers, I figured it would be a good opportunity to add a sample of what HOBA looks like for WWW-Authenticate and Authorization. As it was easily misunderstood by coworkers trying to extract it from the RFC.
items.title: Add HOBA sample to the www-authenticate index.md

Additional details

items.title: Update JS perf article, also make small fix to isInputPending

items.content_html:
This PR adds spaces after and before the brackets of objects in JavaScript, along with other spacing tweaks. (Ex. {foo: bar} becomes { foo: bar }.) This is helpful for legibility purposes.

Note: this PR may contain other formatting tweaks that are too integrated to separate.
items.title: Add spacing in between brackets of objects in JS

items.content_html:
This PR fixes the formatting of various objects described in JavaScript and JSON code in the WebExtensions pages. In a lot of objects, there was odd spacing before the colons, or redundant quotes added to the keys when defining the objects in JavaScript. This PR aims to fix such instances.

Note: other small formatting changes may have been included in this PR as well.
items.title: Fix formatting of JS/JSON objects in WebExtensions pages

items.content_html:
FF116 adds support for the Audio Output Device API.

This improves some of the docs. There feels like quite a lot of duplication, in particular around the way permissions/security considerations work. But at least it should not be "wrong". Happy to take advice.

Other docs work can be tracked in #27748
items.title: FF116 Audio Output Device API updates

items.content_html:
Description

Updated code in Javascript Closures to prevent in throwing error.

function outer() {
  const x = 5;
  if (Math.random() > 0.5) {
    const y = 6;
    return () => console.log(x, y);
  }
}

to

function outer() {
  const x = 5;
  const y = 6;
  return () => console.log(x, y);
}

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Closures#closure_scope_chain

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #27790
items.title: Updated Javascript Closures Code

items.content_html:
While doing the page-type project, we forgot some pages here or there (or they got added right after an area was converted without having a page-type YAML key.

This PR adds the missing page types in the 50-or-so pages that didn't have one. After this PR (and the two others still open), all MDN pages should have a page-type. (A last check will be made before closing the issue).

Note: no new page type is introduced by this PR

This is part of openwebdocs/project#91 and will close #27620.
items.title: Add page-types to remaining pages

Motivation

Additional details

Here's the lesson I edited.

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: fix: revise active learning exercise

items.content_html:
Description

Fenced frames are an integral part of Google's privacy sandbox technologies. Many parts of this set are being made available by default in Chrome 115 (depending on a gradual ramp up to 100% of userbase over the 115 release period).

This PR provides documentation for the <fencedframe> element and the APIs that underpin it.

See my research document for more details of exactly what changes are expected in the PR.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add documentation for Fenced Frames

items.content_html:
This adds page types for WebAssembly. I tried to stay as close as possible as the Web APIs page types for the JS API. There are also guide and landing-page, as well as webassembly-instruction for the pages with opcodes.

  • webassembly-function: a global function, that is a method directly under the WebAssembly object that acts as a namespace, like WebAssembly.instantiate().
  • webassembly-constructor: a constructor, like WebAssembly.Exception().
  • webassembly-interface: a WebAssembly interface, like WebAssembly.LinkError.
  • webassembly-instance-property: an instance property, like WebAssembly.Instance.exports.
  • webassembly-instance-method: an instance method, like WebAssembly.Exception.getArg().
  • webassembly-static-method: a static method, like WebAssembly.Module.exports().
  • webassembly-instruction: an instruction, or a set of instructions, like Wrap.

This is a part of openwebdocs/project#91
items.title: Add page types for the WebAssembly section

items.content_html:
Description

The syntax of the offset-position property has changed.

  • A new keyword (normal) has been added: https://drafts.fxtf.org/motion/#offset-position-property

This PR updates the offset-position property page:

  • Adds the new normal keyword
  • Updates the description of the auto keyword
  • Adds a "Result" frame for the existing example
  • Adds a new example to show the difference in the values of the offset-position property (codepen: https://codepen.io/dipikabh/pen/oNQZyOm)

Caveats

  • Firefox has newly added support for the offset-position property behind the pref layout.css.motion-path-offset-position.enabled.
  • To view the example containing the ray() function, the pref layout.css.motion-path-ray.enabled will also need to be enabled
  • The code example is based on the (expected) behavior I tested in Nightly. I did not see the expected behavior of normal in Firefox beta 115.0b9.

Related issues and pull requests

Doc tracker for this update: #27174
Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1559232

To Dos

  • Update BCD: mdn/browser-compat-data#20250
  • Update release notes: #27730
  • Update mdn/data: mdn/data#673
items.title: docs(css): Fx115 - Update "offset-position" property syntax

items.content_html:
On line 14 removed:
"(except when the latter sibling needs to be cleared past floats)" I was unable to replicate the case where a latter sibling clearing past floats would not collapse the margin. The only way I could force this was by floating the latter sibling, too.

Description

modify margin collapsing case dealing with adjacent siblings

I was unable to replicate the case where a latter sibling clearing past floats would not collapse the margin. The only way I could force this was by floating the latter sibling, too.

Motivation

I would like for others to not get confused.

The readers will not get stuck when trying to understand margin collapsing.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: modify margin collapsing case dealing with adjacent siblings
